Highest Composite
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 4 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here) : Highest Composite
By King Bunny on Friday, April 18, 2008 - 11:12 pm:

Hellow kiddies? How're you? Miss me much? Well, let's get past the formalities and get down to business...

Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 4 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here) : Maxed Monsters?

In that thread, it asked what the highest composite stats were for monsters. I was wondering this too, however, the thread is a few years old and it's closed down... so, what is the current max composite? Any general idea of how it was achieved?

From the little I've read last night, some tips seem to be to use M Lv. 2 Gadgets, have a wind drum (may not apply), feed watermelons, use oily oils (may not apply), use vitamins for weight.

That pretty much seems to be the gist of what raising should be, but I couldn't seem to find any hardcore "method" such as in MR2 or MR3.

By Lisa Shock on Saturday, April 19, 2008 - 09:42 am:

I think that's about it. IIRC, Petit Trot & SlapShotz had some of the highest stats of anyone playing this game, but you can see a lot of people's monster's stats here:

Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Coliseum (Public Monster Rancher Tournaments): Mayors Cup: Metropolis Champions (MR4)

Maybe you could email them and ask if they had any sort of setup they recommend.

By Infernus on Saturday, April 19, 2008 - 03:30 pm:

I haven't played in a long time, but I know a few of us were up around 4000 (+ or -) towards the end.

A lot of people were playing around with different ideas, using a lot of the things you mentioned; but I don't think there were any set in stone methods, just general methods.

By King Bunny on Saturday, April 19, 2008 - 11:31 pm:

And since I don't want to make too much clutter by starting a new thread, any chance for a low compositie tourney?

By King Bunny on Wednesday, April 23, 2008 - 11:40 pm:

I'd want to do it and be willing to, but... can't.

I'm in a different time zone (Pakistan).
There are planned power shut downs here and there is no schedule for them, so the power may go out right in the middl of a fight and well... That'd leave everyone hanging.
I'm on dial-up and haven't tested whether I can access the chat room on MRM. I've tried chatrooms on other sites (facebook for example) and they don't seem to work with dial-up.

That being said, if we can find a host, I think it'd be pretty cool to get a tourney in. Perhaps a FFA or a Baby Challenge of sort so anyone can enter? Or a low composite like 1k or something?

If we don't have a host by say, end up July, I'd be willing to do it because I'll be in Australia then so the last two points will be moot and there'll only be a time zone difference, but I'm sure we can accomodate something on that.

By Infernus on Thursday, April 24, 2008 - 01:49 pm:

I think you'll have more trouble finding entrants than a host. Not only that, but if you do find either one, you're going to have to deal with all the Max Drive/X-Port (or Sharkport) stuff (that is, where someone wants to use or only has one or the other, and someone else can't comply with that, and...yuck...but it's not as much of a problem if the host has both).

MR4 tournaments were never the most popular, and the CP controlled battles were lacking compared to most other games. It'd be nice to see some sort of tournaments being run, though. Having that option there is always nice.

I still have an MR2 monster that needs some action...
